title: About Coronavirus
licenseNotes: Do not change the text of this work, but you may translate it, adapt it into other forms, and distribute it for non-commerical purposes. You must keep the copyrights and credits for the author and illustrator Weiman Kow.
credits: Created by Weiman Kow, instagram: weimankow
summary: This book gives basic advice on dealing with the coronavirus COVID 19

9.en: There's only ONE thing ﻿you need to understand about how a coronavirus

18.en: Keep your distance.﻿2m to 0.5m will keep you safe from large droplets.

22.en: So if you see someone who is visibly coughing/sneezing/sick you can choose to:

23.en: Give them a mask.﻿They can cough or sneeze in it and protects everyone else nearby

27.en: Maybe she's not sick, just protecting herself

28.en: People who are infected can show no symptoms, but are still﻿infectious

29.en: And in general, it's a good idea to avoid crowds, because you don't know who might be sick.

37.en: & even on the outside of your face mask

43.en: However, sometimes a sick person's saliva can get on other things…

47.en: And if you do touch any of these things by accident, and then touch your face,

48.en: and the only effective way to get rid of them is to wash them off with soap, bleach, or alcohol.

49.en: Viruses can last for quite a few hours on objects,

52.en: Which is why it is also good to follow these

53.en: wash with soap up to here

56.en: Do not touch your face. (Or anyone else's face.) If you have to, wash your hands with soap thoroughly first.

57.en: Enough time to sing “Happy Birthday” twice

61.en: wash the back of your hands

63.en: If you did, don't worry. Just wash your hands with soap after.

64.en: Also, don't touch the outside of the mask if you can.

66.en: *Bacteria grows on the insides of your mask if you wear them too long

67.en: Throw away masks once they feel gross. Don't wear them for more than a day!

73.en: Do not share food, utensils, cups, towels.

74.en: You can't touch your face with your elbow even if you tried

75.en: Open & close doors with your elbows or shoulders instead of hands, if possible.

77.en: and after being out in the public

79.en: Always wash your hands with soap…

85.en: Read the articles for more tips!

86.en: "This animation shows how far your sneeze can actually travel" by Chia Yi Hou and Andrea Schmitz, in Business Insider (Jan 21, 2020)

87.en: "The Wuhan Virus: How to stay safe", by Laurie Garrett, in Foreign Policy, Report. (Jan 25, 2020)

88.en: "How to avoid the coronavirus? Wash your hands", by Elizabeth Rosenthal, in the New York Times, Opinion. (Jan 28, 2020
